instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board, it turns on normally, but no display.

It displays image to an external monitor, but its own LCD remains black like it has not been plugged in the board.

L8300 5V appear in the first few seconds w/ or w/o LCD connected.

<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0V always.

Just 5.1 V pin 3-4 J8300

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
"L8300 5V appear in the first few seconds w/ or w/o LCD connected."
Check if <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> go both high at same time; LCD connected, of course.

Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
0 V always on  <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>

unfortunately I don't have a good LCD.

Anything else I can do?

I would not like to think that the PCH is damaged

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image, no backlight
threads.message:
PCH expects <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> signal, prior to enable internal video.
Looks like you have a bad LCD...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image, no backlight
threads.message: Tank you Sr. i'am wating for a new screen
